query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Al fine de le sue parole il ladro 2 le mani alzò con amendue le fiche, 3 gridando: «Togli, Dio, ch’a te le squadro!».
query.error: **English:** 1 At the end of his words, the thief 2 raised his hands with both his figs, 3 shouting: "Take that, God, for I am showing them to you!"
query.result: 1 Pada akhir kata-katanya, pencuri itu 2 mengangkat tangannya dengan kedua jarinya, 3 berteriak: "Ambillah, Tuhan, karena aku menunjukkannya kepadamu!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
4 Da indi in qua mi fuor le serpi amiche, 5 perch’ una li s’avvolse allora al collo, 6 come dicesse ‘Non vo’ che più diche’;
query.error: **English:** 4 From there on, the friendly serpents were against me, 5 because one of them then coiled itself around my neck, 6 as if to say ‘I don’t want you to speak any more’;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 e un’altra a le braccia, e rilegollo, 8 ribadendo sé stessa sì dinanzi, 9 che non potea con esse dare un crollo.
query.error: **English:** 7 and another one wrapped itself around my arms, and bound me again, 8 binding itself so tightly in front of me, 9 that I could not move with them.
query.result: 7 dan yang lainnya melilit lenganku, dan mengikatku lagi, 8 mengikat dirinya sendiri dengan sangat erat di depanku, 9 sehingga aku tidak bisa bergerak dengan mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Ahi Pistoia, Pistoia, ché non stanzi 11 d’incenerarti sì che più non duri, 12 poi che ’n mal fare il seme tuo avanzi?
query.error: **English:** 10 Ah, Pistoia, Pistoia, why do you not 11 burn yourself to the ground so that you no longer exist, 12 since your seed excels in wrongdoing?
query.result: 10 Ah, Pistoia, Pistoia, mengapa kamu tidak 11 membakar dirimu sendiri hingga kamu tidak ada lagi, 12 karena benihmu unggul dalam melakukan kejahatan?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Per tutt’ i cerchi de lo ’nferno scuri 14 non vidi spirto in Dio tanto superbo, 15 non quel che cadde a Tebe giù da’ muri.
query.error: **English:** 13 Throughout all the circles of the dark Inferno 14 I saw no spirit so proud in God, 15 not even the one who fell from the walls down to Thebes.
query.result: 13 Di seluruh lingkaran neraka yang gelap 14 aku tidak melihat roh yang begitu sombong kepada Tuhan, 15 bahkan bukan roh yang jatuh dari tembok ke Thebes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 El si fuggì che non parlò più verbo; 17 e io vidi un centauro pien di rabbia 18 venir chiamando: «Ov’ è, ov’ è l’acerbo?».
query.error: **English:** 16 He fled so that he spoke no more words; 17 and I saw a centaur full of rage 18 coming, calling out: "Where is he, where is the fierce one?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Maremma non cred’ io che tante n’abbia, 20 quante bisce elli avea su per la groppa 21 infin ove comincia nostra labbia.
query.error: **English:** 19 Maremma, I don't think it has so many, 20 as many snakes as he had on his back, 21 right up to where our speech begins.
query.result: 19 Maremma, aku tidak percaya bahwa ada sebanyak itu, 20 sebanyak ular yang ada di punggungnya, 21 sampai ke tempat di mana ucapan kita dimulai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Sovra le spalle, dietro da la coppa, 23 con l’ali aperte li giacea un draco; 24 e quello affuoca qualunque s’intoppa.
query.error: **English:** 22 Over his shoulders, behind the haunch, 23 with open wings, a dragon lay upon him; 24 and he sets fire to whomever he encounters.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Lo mio maestro disse: «Questi è Caco, 26 che, sotto ’l sasso di monte Aventino, 27 di sangue fece spesse volte laco.
query.error: **English:** 25 My master said: "This is Cacus, 26 who, beneath the rock of Aventine Mount, 27 often made a pool of blood.
query.result: 25 Guruku berkata: "Ini adalah Cacus, 26 yang, di bawah batu Gunung Aventine, 27 sering membuat kolam darah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Non va co’ suoi fratei per un cammino, 29 per lo furto che frodolente fece 30 del grande armento ch’elli ebbe a vicino;
query.error: **English:** 28 He does not go with his brothers on the same path, 29 because of the fraudulent theft he committed 30 of the great herd that he had nearby;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 onde cessar le sue opere biece 32 sotto la mazza d’Ercule, che forse 33 gliene diè cento, e non sentì le diece».
query.error: **English:** 31 so that his wicked deeds would cease 32 under the club of Hercules, who perhaps 33 gave him a hundred blows, and he did not feel ten of them."
query.result: 31 sehingga perbuatan jahatnya berhenti 32 di bawah gada Hercules, yang mungkin 33 memberinya seratus pukulan, dan dia tidak merasakan sepuluh dari mereka."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Mentre che sì parlava, ed el trascorse, 35 e tre spiriti venner sotto noi, 36 de’ quai né io né ’l duca mio s’accorse,
query.error: **English:** 34 While he spoke thus, and passed on, 35 and three spirits came beneath us, 36 of whom neither I nor my leader was aware,
query.result: 34 Sementara dia berbicara demikian, dan dia lewat, 35 dan tiga roh datang di bawah kami, 36 yang tidak aku maupun pemimpinku ketahui,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 se non quando gridar: «Chi siete voi?»; 38 per che nostra novella si ristette, 39 e intendemmo pur ad essi poi.
query.error: **English:** 37 except when they cried out: "Who are you?" 38 because of which our story was interrupted, 39 and we only understood them afterwards.
query.result: 37 kecuali ketika mereka berteriak: "Siapa kamu?" 38 karena itu cerita kami terputus, 39 dan kami baru mengerti mereka setelah itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Io non li conoscea; ma ei seguette, 41 come suol seguitar per alcun caso, 42 che l’un nomar un altro convenette,
query.error: **English:** 40 I did not know them; but I followed them, 41 as one is wont to follow by chance, 42 that one must call to another,
query.result: 40 Aku tidak mengenal mereka; tetapi aku mengikuti mereka, 41 seperti seseorang yang biasa mengikuti secara kebetulan, 42 bahwa seseorang harus memanggil yang lain,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 dicendo: «Cianfa dove fia rimaso?»; 44 per ch’io, acciò che ’l duca stesse attento, 45 mi puosi ’l dito su dal mento al naso.
query.error: **English:** 43 saying: "Cianfa, where will he have remained?" 44 Because of which, so that the leader would pay attention, 45 I placed my finger from my chin to my nose.
query.result: 43 berkata: "Cianfa, di mana dia akan tinggal?" 44 Karena itu, agar sang pemimpin memperhatikan, 45 Aku meletakkan jariku dari daguku ke hidungku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Se tu se’ or, lettore, a creder lento 47 ciò ch’io dirò, non sarà maraviglia, 48 ché io che ’l vidi, a pena il mi consento.
query.error: **English:** 46 If you are now, reader, slow to believe 47 what I shall say, it will not be a wonder, 48 for I who saw it, hardly assent to it.
query.result: 46 Jika kamu sekarang, pembaca, lambat untuk percaya 47 apa yang akan kukatakan, itu tidak akan mengherankan, 48 karena aku yang melihatnya, hampir tidak mempercayainya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Com’ io tenea levate in lor le ciglia, 50 e un serpente con sei piè si lancia 51 dinanzi a l’uno, e tutto a lui s’appiglia.
query.error: **English:** 49 As I kept my gaze fixed on them, 50 a serpent with six feet darted out 51 in front of one of them, and clung to it entirely.
query.result: 49 Ketika aku terus menatap mereka, 50 seekor ular dengan enam kaki melesat keluar 51 di depan salah satu dari mereka, dan menempel padanya sepenuhnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 li diretani a le cosce distese, 56 e miseli la coda tra ’mbedue 57 e dietro per le ren sù la ritese.
query.error: **English:** 55 he stretched his hind legs out along his thighs, 56 and put his tail between them both 57 and dragged him backward through the cleft.
query.result: 55 dia merentangkan kaki belakangnya di sepanjang pahanya, 56 dan meletakkan ekornya di antara keduanya 57 dan menyeretnya mundur melalui celah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Ellera abbarbicata mai non fue 59 ad alber sì, come l’orribil fiera 60 per l’altrui membra avviticchiò le sue.
query.error: **English:** 58 Ivy never clung to a tree 59 as the horrible beast 60 entwined its own limbs around the other's body.
query.result: 58 Pohon ivy tidak pernah mencengkeram pohon 59 seperti binatang buas yang mengerikan itu 60 melilitkan anggota tubuhnya sendiri di sekeliling tubuh yang lain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Poi s’appiccar, come di calda cera 62 fossero stati, e mischiar lor colore, 63 né l’un né l’altro già parea quel ch’era:

query.result: 61 Kemudian mereka melekat, seolah-olah mereka terbuat dari lilin panas, 62 dan warna mereka bercampur, 63 tidak satu pun dari mereka tampak seperti sebelumnya:

Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 come procede innanzi da l’ardore, 65 per lo papiro suso, un color bruno 66 che non è nero ancora e ’l bianco more.

query.result: 64 seperti warna cokelat yang muncul sebelum panas, 65 di atas papirus, warna cokelat 66 yang belum hitam dan putihnya memudar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Li altri due ’l riguardavano, e ciascuno 68 gridava: «Omè, Agnel, come ti muti! 69 Vedi che già non se’ né due né uno».
query.error: **English:** 67 The other two looked at him, and each one 68 cried out: "Oh me, Agnello, how you are mutilated! 69 See that you are now neither two nor one."
query.result: 67 Dua yang lain memandangnya, dan masing-masing 68 berseru: "Oh, Agnello, betapa kau termutilasi! 69 Lihatlah bahwa kau sekarang bukan dua atau satu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Già eran li due capi un divenuti, 71 quando n’apparver due figure miste 72 in una faccia, ov’ eran due perduti.
query.error: **English:** 70 The two ends had already become one, 71 when two figures appeared to us, 72 mixed in one face, where two were lost.
query.result: 70 Kedua ujung telah menjadi satu, 71 ketika dua sosok muncul kepada kami, 72 bercampur dalam satu wajah, di mana dua orang telah hilang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Fersi le braccia due di quattro liste; 74 le cosce con le gambe e ’l ventre e ’l casso 75 divenner membra che non fuor mai viste.
query.error: **English:** 73 He made two arms out of four strips; 74 his thighs, legs, belly, and chest 75 became limbs that had never been seen before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Ogne primaio aspetto ivi era casso: 77 due e nessun l’imagine perversa 78 parea; e tal sen gio con lento passo.
query.error: **English:** 76 Every primal aspect there was void: 77 two and none seemed the perverse image; 78 and thus it moved with slow pace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.

query.result: 79 Seperti kadal di bawah cambuk besar 80 hari-hari anjing, berpindah pagar, 81 tampak seperti kilat jika melintasi jalan,

Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.

query.error: **English:** 88 He pierced him and looked at him, but he said nothing; 89 instead, with his feet still, he yawned 90 just as if sleep or fever were attacking him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Elli ’l serpente e quei lui riguardava; 92 l’un per la piaga e l’altro per la bocca 93 fummavan forte, e ’l fummo si scontrava.
query.error: **English:** 91 The serpent and he were looking at each other; 92 one through the wound and the other through the mouth 93 were fuming strongly, and the smoke clashed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Taccia Lucano ormai là dov’ e’ tocca 95 del misero Sabello e di Nasidio, 96 e attenda a udir quel ch’or si scocca.

query.result: 94 Biarlah Lucan sekarang berdiam di sana di mana dia menyentuh 95 tentang Sabellus dan Nasidius yang malang, 96 dan biarlah dia mendengarkan apa yang sekarang sedang dilontarkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Taccia di Cadmo e d’Aretusa Ovidio, 98 ché se quello in serpente e quella in fonte 99 converte poetando, io non lo ’nvidio;
query.error: **English:** 97 Ovid be silent about Cadmus and Arethusa, 98 for if he, in his poetry, transformed the former into a serpent and the latter into a fountain, I do not envy him; 99 for never did he transform two natures face to face

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 ché due nature mai a fronte a fronte 101 non trasmutò sì ch’amendue le forme 102 a cambiar lor matera fosser pronte.
query.error: **English:** 100 For never did two natures face to face 101 so transform themselves that both forms 102 were ready to change their matter.
query.result: 100 Karena tidak pernah dua sifat yang berhadapan langsung 101 begitu berubah sehingga kedua bentuknya 102 siap untuk mengubah materi mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Insieme si rispuosero a tai norme, 104 che ’l serpente la coda in forca fesse, 105 e ’l feruto ristrinse insieme l’orme.
query.error: **English:** 103 Together they answered you in such a way, 104 that the serpent made his tail into a fork, 105 and the wounded one drew his footprints together.
query.result: 103 Bersama-sama mereka menjawabmu sedemikian rupa, 104 sehingga ular itu membuat ekornya menjadi garpu, 105 dan yang terluka itu menyatukan jejak kakinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Le gambe con le cosce seco stesse 107 s’appiccar sì, che ’n poco la giuntura 108 non facea segno alcun che si paresse.
query.error: **English:** 106 His legs with his thighs 107 clung together so tightly that soon 108 the juncture made no sign that was apparent.
query.result: 106 Kakinya dengan pahanya 107 saling menempel erat, sehingga segera 108 persendian itu tidak menunjukkan tanda apa pun yang terlihat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Togliea la coda fessa la figura 110 che si perdeva là, e la sua pelle 111 si facea molle, e quella di là dura.
query.error: **English:** 109 The foolish tail removed its shape 110 that was lost there, and its skin 111 became soft, and that of the other hard.
query.result: 109 Ekor yang bodoh itu menghilangkan bentuknya 110 yang hilang di sana, dan kulitnya 111 menjadi lembut, dan kulit yang lain menjadi keras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Io vidi intrar le braccia per l’ascelle, 113 e i due piè de la fiera, ch’eran corti, 114 tanto allungar quanto accorciavan quelle.
query.error: **English:** 112 I saw them enter the arms through the armpits, 113 and the two feet of the beast, which were short, 114 lengthen as much as those [arms] shortened.
query.result: 112 Aku melihat mereka masuk ke dalam lengan melalui ketiak, 113 dan kedua kaki binatang buas itu, yang pendek, 114 memanjang sejauh lengan-lengan itu memendek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Poscia li piè di rietro, insieme attorti, 116 diventaron lo membro che l’uom cela, 117 e ’l misero del suo n’avea due porti.
query.error: **English:** 115 Then his feet, twisted together behind, 116 became the member that a man conceals, 117 and the wretch had two outlets for his filth.
query.result: 115 Kemudian kakinya di belakang, terpilin bersama, 116 menjadi anggota yang disembunyikan lelaki, 117 dan si malang itu memiliki dua lubang untuk kotorannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Mentre che ’l fummo l’uno e l’altro vela 119 di color novo, e genera ’l pel suso 120 per l’una parte e da l’altra il dipela,

query.result: 118 Sementara asap itu menutupi keduanya 119 dengan warna baru, dan menumbuhkan bulu di atas 120 di satu sisi dan mencabutnya di sisi lain,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 l’un si levò e l’altro cadde giuso, 122 non torcendo però le lucerne empie, 123 sotto le quai ciascun cambiava muso.
query.error: **English:** 121 one rose up and the other fell down, 122 not turning away, however, the wicked lamps, 123 under which each one changed his face.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Quel ch’era dritto, il trasse ver’ le tempie, 125 e di troppa matera ch’in là venne 126 uscir li orecchi de le gote scempie;
query.error: **English:** 124 That which was straight, he drew towards his temples, 125 and from too much material that came there 126 the ears emerged from the simple cheeks;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 ciò che non corse in dietro e si ritenne 128 di quel soverchio, fé naso a la faccia 129 e le labbra ingrossò quanto convenne.

query.result: 127 yang tidak mengalir kembali dan dipertahankan 128 dari kelebihan itu, membuat hidung untuk wajah 129 dan menebalkan bibir sebanyak yang sesuai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Quel che giacëa, il muso innanzi caccia, 131 e li orecchi ritira per la testa 132 come face le corna la lumaccia;
query.error: **English:** 130 He who lay down thrusts his snout forward, 131 and draws his ears back along his head 132 as a snail does its horns;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 e la lingua, ch’avëa unita e presta 134 prima a parlar, si fende, e la forcuta 135 ne l’altro si richiude; e ’l fummo resta.
query.error: **English:** 133 and the tongue, which he had kept united and ready 134 to speak before, he splits, and the forked part 135 closes up in the other; and the smoke remains.
query.result: 133 dan lidah, yang telah ia satukan dan siap 134 untuk berbicara sebelumnya, ia membelah, dan bagian yang bercabang 135 menutup di bagian lainnya; dan asapnya tetap ada.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 L’anima ch’era fiera divenuta, 137 suffolando si fugge per la valle, 138 e l’altro dietro a lui parlando sputa.
query.error: **English:** 136 The soul that had become proud, 137 hissing, flees through the valley, 138 and the other, speaking, spits after him.
query.result: 136 Jiwa yang telah menjadi sombong, 137 mendesis, melarikan diri melalui lembah, 138 dan yang lainnya, berbicara, meludah mengejarnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Poscia li volse le novelle spalle, 140 e disse a l’altro: «I’ vo’ che Buoso corra, 141 com’ ho fatt’ io, carpon per questo calle».
query.error: **English:** 139 Then he turned his new shoulders to him, 140 and said to the other: "I want Buoso to run, 141 as I have done, on all fours along this path."
query.result: 139 Kemudian dia memalingkan bahu barunya kepadanya, 140 dan berkata kepada yang lain: "Aku ingin Buoso berlari, 141 seperti yang telah kulakukan, merangkak di sepanjang jalan ini."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Così vid’ io la settima zavorra 143 mutare e trasmutare; e qui mi scusi 144 la novità se fior la penna abborra.
query.error: **English:** 142 Thus I saw the seventh ballast 143 change and transform; and here let the novelty 144 excuse me if my pen shuns flowers.
query.result: 142 Begitulah kulihat pemberat ketujuh 143 berubah dan bertransformasi; dan di sinilah kebaruan 144 memaafkanku jika penaku menghindari bunga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.

query.result: 145 Dan meskipun mataku yang bingung 146 agak redup dan pikiranku kacau, 147 mereka tidak dapat melarikan diri begitu tersembunyi,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
151 l’altr’ era quel che tu, Gaville, piagni.
query.error: **English:** 151 the other was he whom you, Gaville, mourn.
